review_title: I feel blessed to be a part of this company
pros:
This company is the complete package. Great people to work with, fast paced environment, always exciting, beautiful atmosphere, GREAT benefits, and pay, always room to grow if you want to learn other aspects of the business.

 I personally feel I have a great work life balance, you're always challenged, and hone your skills in problem solving which I quite like. A place where you have an opportunity to be recognized for your work ethic and efforts.

You earn flex hours, and with enough seniority earn up to 2 paid days off a month, so great paid vacation time, if you use it right. 

Point system of 30 days, so if you miss work, you get a point. If you dont miss anymore or are late in a month, the point falls off, giving you a fresh start. 

I feel most people are happy there. The ones who know how to appreciate when they have it good anyway. The philosophy of the company is, you go above and beyond, help us earn this good reputation in the industry, help us keep good ratings, give great guest service where we earn their patronage and want to be repeat guests, and we will in turn take care of you in spades, and boy they do. They think of everything. I have never felt more cared for, appreciated at a job in my life, and I couldn't be more proud to work for them. 

AND during the pandemic the ONLY property on the strip to not only pay not just Venetian/Palazzo tm's salaries the whole shutdown WITH BENEFITS (which are FREE) Mr.Adelson paid for all the vendor's and tipped employees too. His commitment to us is astounding, and I dont have enough words to express my gratitude.
And even though now we're slow after reopening, has commited to paying us an automatic 24 hrs a week with full benefits. Medical, dental, vision. Mental health, 401k and did have 50% match prior to pandemic. I couldn't be more grateful or prouder. Honestly

review_title: Solid Pick for the Long Haul
pros:
An extremely stable company, with an extremely stable technology department. Internal promotion is common, and can be expected after putting in the time with stable, performance.

Compensation is reasonable, benefits are solid across the board (insurance, 401k, other perks). Working hours are well-defined and do not often stray outside of their definitions.
cons: Very bureaucratic, with lots of red tape characteristic of almost all large, conservative companies. Policies are somewhat archaic and apply almost universally to all employees. Understand the policies and adhere to them, and don't get too salty, and it won't bother you in the day-to-day.

pros: Benefits 100% paid which is nice. Discounts to shops and restaurants within casinos. The pay is on the higher side compared to other resorts in Las Vegas.
cons: Management is wishy washy and unstable.  You will never get promoted within unless you know personally a higher up/director. There is little to no movement or growth opportunity. Brings in lots of contractors then releases so there too many different hands with no consistency. Overall I would say very poorly managed from top down.

pros:
Awesome investment in employees, SANS courses, training, etc.
Money is where there mouth is for tools and training. 
4-10's after 90 days.
Salary with Overtime Eligibility.
cons:
Office is the most political office I've ever worked with, there are favorites and it shows, and if you're not on the favorites list you should worry about your job. 

Training program is inconsistent, changing, and a joke, the company is looking for people who have experience already, and berate you for not having mastered every program by a month or two when they won't even let you touch anything for your first month usually since you're still waiting for access. 

Department doesn't know how to teach, and has you drink from the fire hose or a dripping faucet with the material.  Designated trainers don't line up with new hire schedules, and expect you to know what you don't know so you can train yourself in their absence. Playbooks are created for how to do job functions, but training won't ask any question about how to do the job, but how the network is mapped out or where specific buttons are.

Every mistake you make will be analyzed under the microscope. For example there are templates done one way by half the department and another by the other half, and both will comment on mistakes you made for doing even after checking with someone.  We're talking things such as whether or not to includes brackets and then a colon or no brackets in an email level of micromanagement and criticism.

Office has a full military mindset, 90% of the office are from various branches, and the attitude fills the office and shapes procedures. There is not really a unified team, it's just a bunch of cyber-soldiers powering through alerts and logs. Everybody has their own branch, their own sports team, etc and will constantly jab and harass each other over these.

review_title: Awesome brand potential, high turn-over, horrible employee culture and benefits
pros: The company pays stronger than other strip properties in an attempt to combat high turn-over and extremely challenging work environment.
cons:
Where to start. We will attempt to stick to the facts of our experience.

The brand has amazing potential, but the current operating state is horrible and managed so poorly, its obvious it's all about the money and not about the employees.

Due to poor traffic management it takes employees 60 minutes to and from the property unpaid to arrive and leave. Plan accordingly if you have children.

15 minute Breaks. You will receive no 15 minute breaks unless you take up smoking.

We received a new manager every 6 months and had to rebuild the relationships each time which was frustrating.

No promotion opportunities.

Company healthcare denies most claims and you have to call multiple times to get the issues resolved.

There is onsite child care. Openings are rare. The price is higher than other providers for some reason.

You will work a minimum 10 hour days, average 11 hour days. They work you to get the job done and if you dont like it they will let you know you can be easily replaced. Work and life balance are nonexistent.

Upper Management and Executive Management consists of many highly political persons and turned every 6 months.

Lunch Breaks. The 'free' food is consistently unidentifiable and many employees refuse to eat there after getting sick right after lunch time. You can also pay 12-15 per day for lunch on the property and it's quality will be fried, unhealthy and high questionable.

To survive you must not say any other words other than 'yes'. The company thrives on 'yes' management, even if it means breaking protocols, compliance, rules, laws.

The employee areas often are stacked with garbage and old food and thus smells horrible as you travel from work area to area.

Your training will be doing your job. You will receive no structured training. And if you do not perform to unreasonable expectations you will be informed you will be replaced easily.

Its obvious they are extremely talented at one thing, intaking volumes of new employees, and creatively separating employees.

Could go on and on but you get the idea. Often we would shake our heads and not believe the level of gross incompetence occurring on all levels in many places in the company. There could be department isolated and happy but for the most part, talking with 100s of employees, the situation became very clear to anyone of reasonable mental competence.
